In the 2nd century BC ( 165 ) , a small army of Jews called the Maccabees staged a rebellion against the Seleucids during their attempts to Hellenize the Jewish people and the land of Israel .

He believed that he himself was Zeus-manifest .
But perhaps his most notorious act was when he desecrated the Temple by slaughtering a pig on the altar .
The Maccabean Revolt commenced in 167 BC following @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Jewish religious practice , which led to a Jewish priest named Mattathias killing a Hellenized Jew who made sacrifices to idols .
